p: The healers collected most of their medicinal plants from the community forests surrounding their villages (81 spp., 50%) followed by forest protected by the government Phu Dan Suang, (56 spp., 34%), home gardens (38 spp., 23%), and around the village (8 spp., 5%). Swamps were the least used habitat for collecting medicinal plants with only one species (<1%). The majority of medicinal plants were native to Thailand, while, 18 spp. of medicinal plants were exotic (11%). Most of the exotic plants were found in their home garden (10 spp., 5%), followed by community forest (5 spp., 2%) ( Table S1).
